37#include <sys/cdefs.h>
38__RCSID("$NetBSD: mech_login.c,v 1.3 2011/02/11 23:44:43 christos Exp $");
39
40#include <assert.h>
41#include <saslc.h>
42#include <stdio.h>
43#include <string.h>
44
45#include "mech.h"
46#include "saslc_private.h"
47
48
49/* Non-standard: no RFC. */
50
51/* properties */
52#define SASLC_LOGIN_AUTHCID SASLC_PROP_AUTHCID
53#define SASLC_LOGIN_PASSWD SASLC_PROP_PASSWD
54
55/**
56 * @brief doing one step of the sasl authentication
57 * @param sess sasl session
58 * @param in input data
59 * @param inlen input data length
60 * @param out place to store output data
61 * @param outlen output data length
62 * @return MECH_OK - success,
63 * MECH_STEP - more steps are needed,
64 * MECH_ERROR - error
65 */
66/*ARGSUSED*/
67static int
68saslc__mech_login_cont(saslc_sess_t *sess, const void *in __unused,
69 size_t inlen __unused, void **out, size_t *outlen)
70{
71 saslc__mech_sess_t *ms = sess->mech_sess;
72
73 switch (ms->step) {
74 case 0:
75 if (saslc__mech_strdup(sess, (char **)out, outlen,
76 SASLC_LOGIN_AUTHCID,
77 "authcid is required for an authentication") == MECH_OK)
78 return MECH_STEP;
79 else
80 return MECH_ERROR;
81 case 1:
82 return saslc__mech_strdup(sess, (char **)out, outlen,
83 SASLC_LOGIN_PASSWD,
84 "passwd is required for an authentication");
85 default:
86 assert(/*CONSTCOND*/0); /* impossible */
87 return MECH_ERROR;
88 }
89}
90
91/* mechanism definition */
92const saslc__mech_t saslc__mech_login = {
93 .name = "LOGIN",
94 .flags = FLAG_PLAINTEXT,
95 .create = saslc__mech_generic_create,
96 .cont = saslc__mech_login_cont,
97 .encode = NULL,
98 .decode = NULL,
99 .destroy = saslc__mech_generic_destroy
100};
101
